Replace.Text: Container of the Light, with 52 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength, 6 [ICON_Movement] Movement.
A Classical Wonder unique to the HollowNest civilization, can only be built in cities with the Black Egg Temple District and on Hills. Units atop the Watcher's Spire gain +12 sight range.
He lies at the top of this tower, beside which stands a telescope that overlooks the city. Here lie some remnants of the Watcher, most now corpses.
Units atop the Watcher's Spire gain +12 sight range and can see through Rainforests.

A unique city center building for the leader Grimm, providing +2 [ICON_Gold] Gold, +2 [ICON_Faith] Faith, +2 [ICON_Culture] Culture, +2 [ICON_Amenities] Amenities, +2 [ICON_GreatArtist] Great Artist points, +1 [ICON_GreatMusician] Great Musician points, +2 [ICON_GreatWork_Writing] Writing slots, and +1 [ICON_GreatWork_Music] Music slot. The theatrical performances of the Grimm Troupe are very inspiring. Within one ring of the Grimm Troupe, your units heal additional HP when resting, and military units gain +3 [ICON_Strength].

Replaces the Arena. Only the bravest and strongest can survive the hellish trials and earn substantial gold rewards in the Colosseum of Fools, which also leads to the high maintenance cost of the arena, and those who are not careful will leave with regret and unwillingness. Requires less [ICON_Production] Production to construct (150 [ICON_Production] -> 100 [ICON_Production]). Provides +3 [ICON_Amenities] Amenities as an entertainment complex. Maintenance cost: 8 [ICON_Gold] Gold (base 2 [ICON_Gold] Gold, and each of the three trials in the arena corresponds to 1, 2, 3 [ICON_Gold] Gold). Offers +3 [ICON_GreatWork_Relic] Relic slots. Increases production of military units in this city by 100% [ICON_Production], and if the city also has a Encampment, the production is further increased by 100% [ICON_Production].

Replaces the Library, requiring higher production cost (90 [ICON_Production] -> 120 [ICON_Production]), and maintenance cost of 1 [ICON_Gold] Gold. Teacher Monomon pursued change and made significant contributions to the scientific and educational development of HollowNest. The archives contain manuscripts of Teacher Monomon. Upon completion, randomly receive one Industrial Era or earlier [ICON_TechBoosted] Eureka and [ICON_CivicBoosted] Inspiration each. Provides +2 [ICON_Science] Science, +2 [ICON_Culture] Culture, +2 [ICON_GreatScientist] Great Scientist points, +1 [ICON_GreatArtist] Great Artist point, and +2 [ICON_GreatWork_Writing] Writing slots.

Replaces the Amphitheater, with reduced production cost (150 [ICON_Production] -> 120 [ICON_Production]) and maintenance cost of 1 [ICON_Gold] Gold. The Songstress often create songs and sing the most beautiful music in all of HollowNest, with lingering melodies that are enchanting. Provides +2 [ICON_Culture] Culture, +3 [ICON_GreatMusician] Great Musician points, and +3 [ICON_GreatWork_Music] Music slots. Upon completion, triggers a random [ICON_CivicBoosted] Inspiration from any era each time a new era is entered. [Note: This effect is based on the era corresponding to your best technology or civic, not the world era.]

Replaces the Holy Site, with maintenance cost of 1[ICON_Gold] Gold, and significantly reduced production cost(54[ICON_Production]->18[ICON_Production]). The King's Statue stands amidst the fountain in the center of the square, revered by the bugs. Palace Grounds receive a bonus of 1 from adjacent districts, providing +4[ICON_Faith] Faith. Grants +2[ICON_GreatProphet] Great Prophet points.

Replaces the Commercial Hub. As an important hub of transportation, the Crossroads witness a constant stream of bugs traversing the hills and seas, reflecting the economic and cultural prosperity of HollowNest Civilization. The adjacency bonus is changed to +1, providing equivalent [ICON_Culture] Culture and [ICON_Production] Production to the adjacency bonus of the district. Provides more [ICON_Food] Food, [ICON_Production] Production, and [ICON_Gold] Gold for domestic trade routes (0[ICON_Food]1[ICON_Production]0[ICON_Gold]->2[ICON_Food]2[ICON_Production]1[ICON_Gold]), and more [ICON_Gold] Gold for international trade routes (3[ICON_Gold]->6[ICON_Gold]). Upon completion, [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Route capacity increases by 1, and a Merchant unit is granted.
Temple of the Black Egg Square

[Note: This district uses the Holy Site model, please carefully identify the area when playing the game] A unique district of the HollowNest civilization, does not replace any district, no population requirement, can only be built in one city, construction costs greatly reduced, disappears when the city is occupied. Provides +3 adjacency bonus to most common districts and a few unique districts. Grants +3 [ICON_Science], +3 [ICON_Culture], +3 [ICON_Gold], +3 [ICON_Faith], +3 [ICON_Food], +3 [ICON_Production]. Provides double the bonus of the Government Plaza for international and domestic trade. Pillaging this district can yield twice the [ICON_Faith] Faith of pillaging a Holy Site. Upon completion, can recruit a Hollow Knight regardless of tech restrictions. Hollow Knights adjacent to this district gain +25 [ICON_Strength].
+25 [ICON_Strength] strength from adjacent Temple of the Black Egg Square
+{1_num} [ICON_Culture] from adjacent Temple of the Black Egg Square
+{1_num} [ICON_Faith] from adjacent Temple of the Black Egg Square
+{1_num} [ICON_Gold] from adjacent Temple of the Black Egg Square
+{1_num} [ICON_Production] from adjacent Temple of the Black Egg Square
+{1_num} [ICON_Science] from adjacent Temple of the Black Egg Square
Blessing of the Ordinary and Charm Overload

Blessing of the Ordinary: There is a chance for your units to leave behind a [ICON_GreatWork_Relic] Relic upon death. Charm Overload: Gain one wildcard policy slot. Upon entering the Classical Era, gain an additional economic policy slot, and upon entering the Medieval Era, gain another additional economic policy slot. [Note: This effect is based on the era corresponding to your best technology or civic, not the world era.]

The Radiance manipulates the minds of living beings through dream infection, increasing the religious pressure emitted by cities by 10000%. Religious units gain +16 [ICON_Religion] religious strength and +2 proselytizing charges, Apostles automatically gaining the debater and proselytizer promotions. The loyalty of your cities is locked at 100%, and each city exerts +8 loyalty pressure on nearby cities. If other cities lose all loyalty and are subject to The Radiance's maximum loyalty pressure, they skip the Free City phase and immediately join The Radiance.

The Knight has undergone countless trials and tribulations, completing numerous feats including the powerless r045, the Any Radiance 3.0 speedkill, the Path of Pain in 1 minute and 40 seconds, and the any% speedrun in 25 minutes, as well as TASing the entire Hollow Nest. Eventually ascending to become the God of Gods of Hollow Nest. Military units gain +3 [ICON_Strength] strength, and injured military units do not lose strength. Military units gain +400% experience, with experience gains from unit combat capped at the in-game limit of 8. After combat, military units gain additional effects in the following order: 1. Gain an additional 7 experience. 2. Regain 1 health for every 7 experience points. 3. If the enemy is a unit, deal an additional 1 damage for every 7 experience points.
The mighty will of the Void God: +5 [ICON_Strength] strength

The agile leader of HollowNest can effortlessly traverse any location within the civilization. All units gain +2 [ICON_Movement] Movement. When passing through certain terrain features and rivers, they can ignore movement penalties, although they are still subject to zone of control. Settler units receive +150% [ICON_Production] Production for settling. Upon founding or capturing a city, receive a Scout type unit.
Bonus +1 [ICON_Movement] Movement from Exploration of HollowNest
Ignore extra Movement costs from terrain types due to Exploration of HollowNest
Ignore extra Movement costs from crossing rivers due to Exploration of HollowNest

The Pale King, Wyrms, possesses a unique talent for interior design, indicating his exceptional architectural prowess. Most conventional improvements in cities provide an additional +1 [ICON_Food] Food and +4 [ICON_Production] Production. Wyrms adeptly employs sharp saws to adorn every corner of his cities. Citizens and armies alike practice parkour in the saws, enhancing their adaptability to it. Friendly locals are happy to guide outsiders through the ever-changing saws. Enemies unfamiliar with the terrain face considerable challenges in Wyrms' cities, as they gain the "Path of Pain" debuff, within 3 tiles of your city, reducing the maximum Movement of the units by -2 [ICON_Movement] (effects stack, reducing Movement to zero is equivalent to permanent immobilization). Additionally, military units fighting in or adjacent to your territory gain +10 [ICON_Strength] Strength.
Military units gain +10 [ICON_Strength] Strength when fighting in your territory or in tiles adjacent to your territory.

Your Technology costs are reduced by 80%, [ICON_TechBoosted] Eureka moments provide -40%, but [ICON_CivicBoosted] Inspirations provide +40%. Additionally, at the end of each turn, you gain an amount of Gold, Faith, and Science equivalent to 50% of your Culture. Whenever you unlock a Civic, you immediately trigger 1 to 3 [ICON_CivicBoosted] Inspirations (with a high probability of triggering 1), and you immediately receive a large amount of Science (equal to the amount of Culture required to unlock that Civic). Your Great Writers and Great Artists provide +5 [ICON_Strength] Strength to units within 2 tiles of their location. You can construct the unique building, Grimm Troupe, in your cities. See the description for Grimm Troupe for details. All tiles in cities with Grimm Troupe provide +1 [ICON_Culture] Culture and +1 [ICON_Production] Production, with the effects doubling upon researching Printing technology.

Your cities can construct the city center building, Grimm Troupe, providing +2 [ICON_Gold] Gold, +2 [ICON_Faith] Faith, +2 [ICON_Culture] Culture, +2 [ICON_Amenities] Amenities, +2 [ICON_GreatArtist] Great Writer points, +1 [ICON_GreatMusician] Great Musician points, +2 [ICON_GreatWork_Writing] Writing slots, and +1 [ICON_GreatWork_Music] Music slot. The performances of Grimm Troupe inspire your nearby combat units with +3 [ICON_Strength] Strength within 1 tile and provide additional healing during rests.
Units gain +3 [ICON_Strength] Strength when adjacent to Grimm Troupe.
Units gain +20 healing when adjacent to Grimm Troupe.
Provides +5 [ICON_Strength] Strength to units within 2 tiles of Great Writers.
Provides +5 [ICON_Strength] Strength to units within 2 tiles of Great Musicians.
Provides +5 [ICON_Strength] Strength to units within 2 tiles of Great Artists.
Provides +5 [ICON_Strength] Strength to units within 2 tiles of Great Musicians.
Whatever the cost, it was worth it.
You shall seal the blinding light that plagues their dreams.
[COLOR_FLOAT_GOLD]You bow to the Radiance and accept its light.[ENDCOLOR]
Civilization that enjoys entering golden ages accompanied by golden light, slightly disapproves civilizations living in normal ages, and detests civilizations living in dark ages.
...CIVILIZATION THAT DELIGHTS IN ENTERING GOLDEN AGES ACCOMPANIED BY RADIANT LIGHT...
...SLIGHTLY RESENTFUL TOWARDS CIVILIZATIONS NOT IN THE GOLDEN AGE...
...EXTREMELY DISGUSTED WITH CIVILIZATIONS LIVING IN THE DARK AGE...
...I AM RADIANCE. I DO NOT FEAR YOU...
...SINCERELY INVITE YOU TO MY DREAM REALM...
Prefers civilizations not in a Golden Age but doesn't dislike those in one.
Prefer civilizations that strive without the golden aura (non-Golden Age).
Adores civilizations that explore maps extensively, despises those that explore them less.
Favors civilizations that explore the world more.
Dislikes civilizations that lack sufficient understanding of the world.
o((⊙﹏⊙))o (Thinks you're about to start a war)

Prefers clearing all terrain features and improving all improvable tiles. Likes civilizations with a high proportion of improved tiles. Dislikes civilizations with a low proportion of improved tiles or those building national parks.
Likes civilizations that develop many tiles and dislikes national parks.
It's great to see so many improvements in your territory.
Is that how you plan your land?
Hello, I am the Pale King Wyrm, ruler of the Sacred Nest.
Stranger, where do you come from?
I hope you can visit my exquisitely decorated White Palace.
It's great to see the prosperity and splendor of your cities.
May the Sacred Nest and your nation be friends forever.
After careful consideration, I choose to refuse for now.
Can we deepen our cooperation and create glory together?
In the name of the Sacred Nest, I declare war on you!
You should pay the price for your actions. [NEWLINE] (Denouncing you)
Do you intend to wage war on the Sacred Nest?
Is it inevitable to escape such a fate in the end?
Admires civilizations with high culture yields.
Admires civilizations with high culture yields.
I can feel the warmth emanating from the flames you've gathered.
Seek out my kin, collect their flames, and return them to me.
Pleased to meet you, my friend. I am Grimm, leader of this troupe.
Stranger, where do you hail from?
This grand stage you've chosen, a kingdom nurtured by bug and root, is the perfect land for our rituals.
This scorching flame... it bodes well for the rituals.
The Lantern of Nightmares is lit, sealing our pact in crimson flames.
Dance with me, my friend. The audience awaits, let them see how pivotal you are!
I'm certain both of you will become the protagonists of countless glories and tragedies.
Dance with me, my friend. The audience awaits, let them see how pivotal you are!
Begone, back to the darkness, my friend.
Our crimson eyes will be watching you... friend.
A spectacular opening act, the air is filled with fervor. (Thinks you're about to start a war)
Our grand ritual is coming to an end. Will you continue to collect flames, even though you must have seen how they illuminate our path?

Plague, infection, madness entangled with the corpses of the Sanctum's insects... Light screaming out of the eyes of the subjects of this decaying kingdom. Where does it come from? I, a mere mortal, may never understand.

Known as the God of Gods by Seekers, referred to as the Lord of Shadows in game files, often addressed by players as the God of Void. It's a massive void creature with many horns on its head, four arms, eight luminous white eyes, and many twitching tendrils on its back.
A mysterious Wanderer wielding a bone spike as a weapon, delved into the depths beneath the Sanctum's surface, embarking on an adventurous journey.
We should add chainsaws here too.
Oh, the old king of Sanctum... he must have been too eager to save his crumbling little world. The sacrifices he imposed... all for naught.
MY KING... YOU.. ARE AN INCORRIGIBLE ASS! (random interjection)
Through dreams, heed the call of the Lantern, gather flames, and don the crown of decay.
Burn the father, feed the child.
